page.title: 18ST.ANDREW'S SCHOOL
page.content: The first part of the school building, replacing the old stone building which is now the garden centre,was opened by the Bishop of Lincoln in 1962.The school was completed in stages with the final one being the addition of an infant block in 1974. The school has eight classrooms,a large hall,an infant open area,library area various stores and an administration block.There is also a kitchen which is now out of use.The hall is used for school assembly,P.E, Games,Music and Movement etc.and also as a dining hall for those children bringing packed lunches. The school caters for about 200 children from the village and surrounding rural areas.These are split into eight classes according to their age
